Posts.Content: I'm 27 and last Thursday evening found a small, hard lump on the upper, outer quadrant of my right breast. My Mom is a survivor. She found out she had breast cancer when she was 42 (11 years ago) and although it had spread to a few of her lymph nodes, after a lumpectomy, radiation and chemo she is doing wonderfully. Naturally, given my family history which puts me at a higher risk, I have been been very vigilant with myself, and in fact had my baseline mammogram, and due to dense breasts (which my Mom also has) a baseline sonogram done 4 months ago. I will continue to get a mammogram and sonogram yearly from now on. I just started my cycle on Sunday night (4 days after finding the lump) so I am aware that it could be cycle related, although I've never had that occur before. The lump has not reduced in size since I started. My doctor saw me ASAP last Friday and recommended an ultrasound, which I had done yesterday. She said the lump measured about 1/2 centimeter in size and it moves slightly from side to side when palpated, which I know is usually a good sign. It doesn't move in all directions, just from side to side. Also, has anyone ever had a tech say anything positive or negative while undergoing an ultrasound? I could swear that I remember the tech in October, when I had my baseline done, say that everything looked fine, but of course my doctor would get back with me. This technician was very cheerful before and after the exam, but didn't say anything during it. She just measured and clicked on the keyboard. When she was walking me back to the waiting room, all she said was that my doctor would have the report in a day or two and she would get back with me. After my doctor telling me Friday that usually the techs are pretty good at saying "oh it looks fine, but your doctor will call you" the fact that she didn't say anything concerns me. I haven't gotten the u/s results yet and although I know *most* malignancies are lumps that don't move freely, I wanted to know what the chances are that a malignant tumor would move from side to side? My fiancee keeps telling me not to worry, but I'm sure you all can relate when I say that's hard to do! I'm hoping to get the results from the doctor tomorrow, and if it's a solid mass instead of a cyst, I will insist on a biopsy, just for my peace of mind if nothing else. (if you made it this far, sorry for the novel! )
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by Fabat40 I'll be praying that it's nothing. Thank you! I'm hoping to get results today so I'll know what the next step is...
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by blossom64 don't be disheartened sweetie if it doesn't show anything, mine didn't, and the X-ray doc came in and told me that I had prominent milk duct glands and just to keep an eye on it. I wish I had been more diligent with my self-breast exams. I had been so sick from meds then the flu I didn't do them like I should have, and when I had that ultrasound I really doubted that it was nothing because I could feel the lump and so could the U/S tech. Let me know what your results say. Hugs, Blossom When my Mom had hers done they told her it didn't look like anything to worry about, that she had dense breasts and it was normal for her, and to come back in six months. Thankfully she got a second opinion because it was cancer and it had already spread to a few of her nodes when they did her lumpectomy. I will keep you updated! Trust me I plan on making sure they take the lump out, whatever it is, and do testing on it! (((((HUGS))))) to you too.
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by girlwondering Mommy2Baz, I know you want reasurance, but unfortunately, nobody but your doctor can tell you what you're dealing with. We're all here for you, but to speculate on your lump would be too hard for me to do! I CAN tell you that the majority of all lumps ARE benign, so try to keep that in mind, despite your family history (which I have too!). Keep us posted, Karie Thanks for your reply I'm hoping the doctor will call me today. I called yesterday and they hadn't received anything, and my doc was out of the office. They said they'd call radiology today if they hadn't heard anything. I'll keep you posted, thanks!
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by girlwondering I just logged on to find out if you have had any results yet...Keeping you in my good thoughts! Please keep us up to date when you hear anything! Karie I am about ready to go to the hospital and start a riot at the radiology department. My doctor's office STILL hasn't gotten a report from them yet and I am going NUTS! (thank you for the good thoughts! I think the radiologist will need some prayers if I ever get ahold of him! )
Posts.Title: Found a lump, waiting on U/S results...

Posts.Content: Dorri - please keep in mind that the only really definitive way to tell whether it is cancer or not is from a biopsy. There are so many cases where the radiologist says it 'looks cancerous' or 'it looks benign' and the results are the total opposite. Many (((HUGS))) for you, your hubby, your MIL and the rest of your family as you face this challenge. My Mom is an (almost) 11 year survivor and she is doing wonderfully!! I myself have a biopsy scheduled for March 6th, to remove a 1 cm lump found by myself, and confirmed by ultrasound. I am 27, my Mom was 43 when she was diagnosed. This disease is SO beatable nowadays! Just be there for your hubby and MIL and know that you all WILL get through this.
Posts.Title: MIL has elongated thickening in breast

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by girlwondering Just to let you know, you are both in my thoughts and prayers. I can understand first-hand how tough this is--I am 34, my mother died of breast cancer after a 6 year battle (which ended last year) and early 2005 I found a series of lumps on my left breast, just under the armpit. Thankfully, they were lumps resulting from "cyclic changes" in my breasts. Please try to keep your chin up until you are given any definite news, whether positive or negative. Your spirit needs optimism or it is too hard to get through the day-to-day. Hugs to you both, Karie Thanks Karie I'm so sorry to hear about your Mom I think going through something myself would be much easier than watching my Mom go through it. So glad to hear your lumps were from cyclic changes. I am hoping that is what mine is, but it hasn't gone away yet and seems to have gotten bigger over the past week. Ah well, will wait until the doc calls me today and then go from there!
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by shelley2977 LADIES, I HAVE JUST READ ALL OF YOUR POSTS AND WANT YOU BOTH TO KNOW I HAVE YOU IN MY THOUGHTS AND PRAYERS. I WAS DIAGNOSED WITH BREAST CANCER JULY 2003 . PLEASE MAKE SURE TO GET ULTRA SOUND OR MRI . EVEN AFTER BOTH OF THESE TESTS THEY STILL DID NOT SEE MY TUMOR. YOU MUST BE PRO ACTIVE AND REALIZE THAT YOU ARE JUST A NUMBER WITH DOCTORS. I AM SORRY TO SAY THIS BUT I AND MY FRIENDS HAVE ALL EXPERIENCED THIS. JUST KNOW THAT NOW A DAYS THE CURE RATE IS SO VERY HIGH (NOT THAT I HOPE EITHER ONE OF YOU HAVE CANCER).WAITING FOR RESULTS SUCK AND YOU MUST BE PUSHY BUT NICE. PEOPLE JUST DON'T GET HOW SCARED YOU ARE WHILE WAITING. I WISH YOU BOTH ALL THE BEST, AND MY HOPE IS THAT YOU BOTH HAVE A BENIGN GROWTHS. REGARDS, SHELLEY Thanks Shelly ((HUG)) My u/s results came back showing a 1 cm mass and I immediately asked my doctor's office to call and make me an appointment with a surgeon - I didn't even wait to see what his recommendation was. I met with the surgeon last Thursday, who immediately said "let's take it out" which was a pleasant surprise. I was expecting him to recommend a needle biopsy first, which I didn't want, but he didn't even suggest that. My excisional biopsy is scheduled for March 6 (13 days and counting) and then I should have the path results within 48 hours. So the wait continues, but at least I feel like I'm being proactive! It took me calling the radiology department at the hospital myself before I found my results!! I have too many other health problems, all centered on my right side, to make me wait any longer for these results!
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by smithn You're right in that the majority of the lumps found in the breast are benign. Also, because your other lump is on your elbow then that is not a swollen lymph node and is therefore unrelated to your breast lump. Rather, the one on your elbow is most likely a lipoma, which can easily be removed in a general surgeon's office. Your breast lump may be a cyst, which will be determined once you get your US results back. I'm happy to hear you are going in for a biopsy. All unknown lumps should be biopsied. Thanks! The lump on my elbow is gone, thankfully. Can't deal with more than one thing at a time! My u/s showed it was not a cyst, rather it's a 1 cm soft tissue mass. My biopsy (an excisional) is scheduled for Monday, and hopefully it will just come back a fibroid! I've been having some sharp pains in my right breast for the past few days (different from cyclical pain, which is more of an ache) so I'm thinking of calling my doc to see if they will do another u/s of both breasts (they just focused on the lump 3 weeks ago), or even an MRI, before my biopsy to make sure there are no other 'problem' areas that need to be examined.
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Rosie, glad it's gone! Lots of women get lumps related to their cycles, so that's probably what yours was. The best way to keep ahead of breast cancer to is be familiar with your own body. I had to point out the lump to my doctor after I found it. She didn't feel it in her breast exam of me. Mine, unfortunately, wasn't cycle related and wasn't a cyst. I'm currently scheduled for surgery to remove it and have it tested for cancer. Ah life...isn't it grand?
Posts.Title: confused over the feel of my breasts...

Posts.Content: I have one that I'm in the process of getting tested (waiting on ultrasound results at the moment). Mine is small and firm, moves slightly from side to side when pushed on and although it can be more difficult for me to find based on the position I'm in, I can still feel it and the size hasn't changed. For instance, when standing or lying somewhat on my left side, with my right arm above my head, it is easier for me to feel than it is if I'm lying flat on my back. I am guessing this might be because I'm large chested so gravity pulls everything downward when I'm lying flat It is impossible to tell the difference between a cancerous lump and a benign lump just by feel alone, although there are sometimes certain "characteristics" of cancerous lumps. All the reading I've done says that *most* cancerous lumps are firm, irregularly shaped, fixed in place. If you have a lump, no matter what you might think the cause, go to your doctor and get it checked out!
Posts.Title: confused over the feel of my breasts...

Posts.Content: I'm going through something similar, so I feel your pain. I found a lump in my right breast last Thursday, had an ultrasound Monday and am waiting on the results. I'm 27, but my Mom is an 11 year survivor, so I've already started having mammograms and ultrasounds (had my baseline for both done 4 months ago and everything looked "normal" then apparently). From what I've learned in my research-driven craze, about 80% of lumps are benign. (((HUGS))) and thoughts for a negative biopsy result.
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: I have a small lump on my right elbow (my breast lump is on the right side too) so of course that's worrying me also, but I figure I can only get through one thing at a time so I'll wait for the results of the ultrasound and then go from there. I've also been dealing with pain in my right arm, shoulder and leg for the past year that I've been told is carpal tunnel - now of course in the middle of the night when I can't sleep because I'm worried about cancer, I wonder if carpal tunnel has been the cause after all. It's terribly scary, but I just keep telling myself that my Mom survived it (I like to say kicked its' butt!) and she was 42 when she was diagnosed. All I can do is deal with the results, no matter what they might be! I have faith that whatever happens, there is a reason behind it, and I'm focusing on my 4 y/o son and 8 y/o step daughter to get me through this darn waiting!! All any of us can do is stay positive when faced with adversity. To dwell on the negative doesn't help at all (although much easier said than done, I know!).
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by blossom64 The reason he's not doing the biopsy for two weeks is I live in a small town and he only comes here once a week and won't be here next week. That has me a bit worried. I tried to move the lump because I read if they move they are most likely a cyst. It didn't move. It's on my left breast below the nipple and to the left an inch. I also read that most benign lumps are on the outside of the breast closer to armpit. I believe I feel two lumps, I don't think he noticed the second one. I know I shouldn't be getting worried yet, but it's kind of hard. My dad died of Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma 11 years ago, so the lymph node that's huge in my left armpit is freaky. I have had enlarged lymph nodes many times, but they always went away after a few days, this has been over two weeks. Trying to maintain, and knowing this two weeks is going to go by so slow. Monday I am seeing an ENT because I am so hoarse (feels like a cotton ball constricting my throat), and I got over the flu a month ago. They are going to do a flexible largynscopy. Thanks for all your support, hugs, Blossom Trust me, I know what you're going through with the waiting. I called my doctor's office this morning and the report still hasn't geen received. I wanted to scream at the receptionist "just call and get it! Don't you know what this is doing to me?!"
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Sometimes being able to rely 100% on God's plan for us is soooo difficult. I'm sorry to hear about your pain problems I hope the lump issue resolves itself quickly and with a good result, so that you can concentrate on healing from your other surgery. The unknown is definitely the worst. I hope that if my lump turns out to be a solid mass that I get a biopsy sooner rather than later. This week wait since I first found the lump has been dragging. Hoping for a result from the u/s tomorrow though!
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by shelley2977 mommy2baz, you go girl! it is so good to hear that you are being proactive. i hope it is just a small 1cm (that's very small) noncancerous growth. the hard part is just waiting for the surgery. most of the time they are noncancerous growths. you are in my thoughts and prayers, you seem like a tough girl , keep taking care of yourself. shelley Thanks Even without my Mom's history of cancer, I would be proactive - plus my hubby wouldn't let me be any other way, haha! Yes, 1 cm is small, so I'm very thankful I even felt it! I'm Italian - you don't wanna mess with me, lol! Thanks for the thoughts and prayers, I will update after the surgery!
Posts.Title: Lump under arm & in breast, biopsy in two weeks 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by Sharon29 I hope this is the right forum to post this questioncause it was deleted out of another forum I thought would be the correct forum for it. I am wondering if any1 (fem) has experianced a loss of sensation in their breasts? I am very big breasted and have been a tummy sleeper all my life, however since I had my son 2.5 years ago my breast seem to have almost no sensetivity anymore. I breastfed my son for the 1st 3 months and I am not sure if that could have caused this or if their is some other underlying problem I should be concerned about? I have a VERY strong history of Breast Cancer in my family which is why this is concering me now. I don't do breast self checks and never have cause I quite frankly to scared to do it!! Thank U My first recommendation - DO SELF CHECKS. My second recommendation - call your doctor and ask them what they think about the loss of sensitivity. I have a history of breast cancer in my family as well. My Mom is a 12 year survivor (she was diagnosed at age 42). I'm currently awaiting surgery to remove a mass found by a self breast exam, that even my doctor missed during her exam of me.
Posts.Title: Breast sensetivity

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by In Hiding My mom went for a biopsy and they had to postpone it becuase they could not locate the clip that was put in about 2 months ago. Is it possible for the thing to move?????? I don't know whether that's possible or not - what did the doctor say to your Mom? Did they reschedule the biopsy? (((HUGS))) I read your other post and know this is tough for you. I was in HS when my Mom was diagnosed. She was 42. She had a lumpectomy, chemo, and radiation. That was 10 years ago and she's healthier than ever! I'm currently scheduled for a biopsy myself (17 days until surgery and counting!) for a lump that I found 2 weeks ago. The u/s showed a 1 cm mass, so I am having an excisional biopsy (meaning they are taking the whole lump, plus some of the tissue margins from around it). I then have to wait 48 hours for the pathology results. The thought that this might be cancer is terrifying - I'm only 27! But I will get through this!! Keep me updated on your Mom, and if you need to talk, please just let me know - I've been there.
Posts.Title: Can a clip inserted after an aspiration move?
